item.title: 没有美国的帮助，欧洲能否自保？我们的 "制衡 "播客进行了调查。敬请收听 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 🎧 。
item.description:

item.title: 乌克兰战争在领土方面的进展停滞不前，但该国在海上取得了更多成功。这些图表和地图显示了俄罗斯全面入侵乌克兰两年后的战况。
item.description:
Progress on the territorial front of the Ukraine war has stalled, but the country is seeing more success at sea. These charts and maps show the state of fighting two years into Russia’s full-scale invasion https://t.co/PJqlC0Ck1g 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 随着日经 225 指数屡创新高，日本的年轻人也开始投资。去年，23% 的 20 多岁年轻人投资了共同基金，高于 2016 年的 6% 👇。
item.description:
As the Nikkei 225 hits record highs, Japan’s young are starting to invest.

23% of people in their twenties invested in mutual funds last year, up from 6% in 2016 https://t.co/bwNH7ohkuB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 监狱工作人员敲诈勒索盛行，贿赂可以买到更好的牢房。1843》杂志深入探讨了俄罗斯刑罚系统的运作。
item.description:
Racketeering by prison staff is endemic and bribery can buy you a better cell. But those who refuse to pay get beaten or tortured.

1843 magazine delves into the workings of Russia’s penal system https://t.co/WzGU2aN6uC

Illustrations: Michelle Thompson / Getty / AP / Capital

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 中层管理者常常被认为是懒惰的。事实上，他们有一个共同的问题👇。
item.description:

item.title: "本-索贝尔（Ben Sobel）在一篇特约撰文中指出："版权法对人工智能的产生构成了深远的威胁。反过来，这位法律学者解释说，"人工智能为更好地重塑版权提供了前所未有的机会"。
item.description:
“Copyright law presents a profound threat to generative AI,” argues Ben Sobel in a guest essay.

In turn, the legal scholar explains, “AI presents an unprecedented opportunity to reshape copyright for the better” https://t.co/0FeVQmEnHs

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 加沙的卫生系统正遭到根深蒂固的破坏。如果战斗继续下去，加沙地带在未来六个月内可能会有 58,000 多人死亡👇。
item.description:
Gaza’s health system is being destroyed at its roots. The strip could see 58,000 excess deaths over the next six months if fighting continues https://t.co/Q7vnmaWqF2 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，教育一直是数字化的落后者。人工智能能否最终改变这一现状？请听 @alice_fulwood, @Birdyword 和 @TomLeeDevlin 的 "Money Talks": 🎧
item.description:
Education has long been a digital laggard. Could AI finally change that? Listen to “Money Talks” with @alice_fulwood, @Birdyword and @TomLeeDevlin: https://t.co/p54RyytATO 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 歐盟國家對烏克蘭難民的慷慨實際上是否正在損害他們試圖幫助的國家的未來？在一场持久战中，如果公民回家，国内经济将更好地支持难民👇。
item.description:
Is the generosity of EU countries towards Ukrainian refugees in fact undermining the future of the country they are trying to help? In a war of endur­ance, the domestic economy will sustain the eﬀort all the better if citizens come home https://t.co/vwq2ebcQ0f 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 迄今为止，20 个百分点的民调领先优势和政府的诱惑力已经说服了英国工党的大多数人，让他们接受基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）爵士所坚持的为取得胜利而必须做出的妥协。但这种情况会持续多久呢？ 👇
item.description:
A 20-point poll lead and the allure of government have so far persuaded most of Britain’s Labour Party to swallow the compromises Sir Keir Starmer insists are necessary for victory. But how long will that last? https://t.co/6pohJL3X9M 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 在 "情报 "节目中，我们的副主编、俄罗斯编辑 @ArkadyOstrovsky 和国防编辑 @shashj 共同探讨了两年来的乌克兰战争。收听播客： 👇
item.description:
On “The Intelligence” our deputy editor, Russia editor @ArkadyOstrovsky and defence editor @shashj examine Ukraine’s war, two years on. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/6tTtligROz 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 当全世界都在关注其他地方的危机时，一场灾难性的地区战争却有可能在刚果爆发。如果不是西方国家的漠不关心，这场战争有可能避免。
item.description:
As much of the world focuses on crises elsewhere, a catastrophic regional war risks being sparked in Congo. It could possibly be averted but for the inattention of the West https://t.co/QQN7eUqjRi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。发展中国家--尤其是印度--应该学习孟加拉国公开、务实的尝试，防止这种情况发生👇。
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Developing countries—especially India—should learn from Bangladesh’s open, pragmatic attempts to prevent this from happening https://t.co/epysLIssb8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 作为英国最受欢迎的海滨度假胜地，黑潭给数百万人带来了欢乐。然而，它也是一个令人绝望的地方，在多项指标上都在全国排名垫底👇。
item.description:
As Britain’s most popular coastal resort, Blackpool brings joy to millions. Yet it is also a repository of despair, at the bottom of national rankings on a host of measures https://t.co/tn8Vh1cbUk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 随着追求健康的年轻人对老式古董酒的回避，模拟鸡尾酒在全球范围内风靡一时。不过，在沙特阿拉伯，最近流行的一种鸡尾酒预示着另一种社会变革👇。
item.description:
Mocktails are having a moment around the world, as health­-crazed young people shun old­-fashioned old fashioneds. In Saudi Arabia, though, a recent mocktail buzz signals a different sort of social change https://t.co/Jc266rkUUx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：乌克兰战争两周年特别节目。未来 12 个月会发生什么？收听每日播客： 👇

item.title: 世界正在目睹一场前所未有的金融战争。但就在西方加紧制裁的同时，规避制裁的方法也变得越来越复杂 👇。
item.description:
The world is witnessing an unprecedented surge in financial warfare. But just as the West ratchets up sanctions, ways to circumvent them are becoming more sophisticated https://t.co/GqWziqAYS1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 自 2016 年以来，秘鲁已成为不稳定的代名词。然而，其货币索尔长期以来一直是南美洲最坚挺的货币。阿根廷总统可以从中吸取教训： 本-希基
item.description:
Since 2016 Peru has become a byword for instability. Yet its currency, the sol, has long been the most solid in South America. There are lessons in this for Argentina’s president: https://t.co/kW4GW8wSrK

Illustration: Ben Hickey pic.twitter.com/uc7CgDe0st

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 全球最大的眼镜制造商希望成为一家科技公司。它正在尝试智能眼镜和内置助听器👇。
item.description:
The world’s biggest maker of spectacles wants to be a tech firm. It is experimenting with smart glasses and built-in hearing aids https://t.co/gr12iuqpUZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: "巴德尔-阿尔布赛义迪在一篇特邀文章中写道："哈马斯是无法根除的。"无论死多少激进分子，他们的事业都将继续存在。他认为，如果要实现和平，和平缔造者就必须找到与他们对话的方式--而且要倾听他们的声音
item.description:
“Hamas cannot be eradicated,” writes Badr Albusaidi in a guest essay. “Their cause will be kept alive however many militants die.” He argues that if there is ever to be peace, the peacemakers have to find a way to talk to them—and to listen https://t.co/YIIXzeUaf1

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 美国陆军的未来在欧洲还是亚洲？它不可能同时在欧洲和亚洲发动战争 👇。

Does the US Army’s future lie in Europe or Asia? It could not wage wars in both at the same time https://t.co/bBw2pZww8W 👇

item.title: ♦️ 查克-舒默访问乌克兰，为援助提供支持。♦️ 尼基-黑莉在自己的主场陷入困境。♦️ 民主党人谴责一项称胚胎为儿童的裁决。关注美国政治最新动态： 👇

item.title: 不要指望美国利率会下降。第二波通胀的风险目前仍然太大 👇
item.description:
Do not expect America’s interest rates to fall yet. The risk of a second wave of inflation remains too great for now https://t.co/9IHatrTAgH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 最近的一篇研究论文指出，由一半美国股票和一半全球股票组成的 100% 股票投资组合很可能会击败分散投资的方法。但这一论点与长期以来的主流建议背道而驰👇。
item.description:
A portfolio of 100% equities, made up of half American and half global stocks, is likely to beat a diversified approach, according to a recent research paper. But that argument flies in the face of longstanding mainstream advice https://t.co/n5qDiGEzjA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 塞内加尔宪法委员会要求政府 "尽快 "举行选举。总统已承诺这样做。这在实践中意味着什么，一直备受争议👇。
item.description:
Senegal’s Constitutional Council has told the government to hold an election “as soon as possible”. The president has promised to do so. What that means in practice has been hotly contested https://t.co/6NxaNCT9X8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024
